title: updatedAda Detective injured during pursuit
content: Detective Brian Engel was on his way home after his shift on Friday evening at just before 7 P.M. when he ended up behind a car as he was driving down the highway. Engel noticed the car had temporary tags and the date on the tag had a purchase date two weeks from now. He activated his lights and the chase was on, reaching speeds in excess of 100 MPH. Engel crashed near the intersection of Hwy 99 and 377 and the suspects gave up shortly afterward and took off running on foot.    It was later determined there were two women and a man in the car the women will not be charged however the man will be. The car was reported stolen out of Grady County and Officers were able to find Leslie Warledo hiding in the woods near the Hwy 99 and 377 interchange at about 12:30 Saturday morning.    Engel was taken to Mercy hospital with a broken nose, ribs and an injured arm. He has since been released from the hospital and is at home resting
